snippet: As the issue of bathroom access grew, the Obama administration was heavily lobbied by rights groups, and resistance escalated in state legislatures and school districts.
abstract: Debate over whether transgender students should be allowed to use bathroom of their choice has evolved from dispute in Palatine, Ill, to nationwide battle, culminating in order from Pres Obama; cultural backlash rippling across nation has been accompanied by intense lobbying of president by rights groups.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG, JULIE BOSMAN, MANNY FERNANDEZ and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

lead_paragraph: As the issue of bathroom access grew, the Obama administration was heavily lobbied by rights groups, and resistance escalated in state legislatures and school districts.

headline.main: How the Push to Advance Bathroom Rights for Transgender Americans Reached the White House
headline.print_headline: New Front Line in Culture War: The Bathroom
